Dialogue: Okay everybody, listen up.

Dialogue: Come in.

Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Dialogue: It's okay.   Come over here.    I need your help.

Dialogue: Ackerman told me everything.

Speaker: cara
Dialogue: I'm sorry Frank.

Dialogue: There's no apology necessary.

Speaker: cara
Dialogue: How do I look?

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: Like the most beautiful woman on earth.

Dialogue: You shouldn't worry about me. What about you?

Dialogue: What about me?

Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: cara
Dialogue: My job.

Dialogue: I look forward to meeting him.

Dialogue: So do I.

Dialogue: What happened? Get it back on line!

Dialogue: What should we do?

Dialogue: Shut up!    Everyone.

Dialogue: Not possible.

Dialogue: What are we going to do?

Dialogue: We're going to wait for Alexander Pearce. Just like them.

Dialogue: Not very polite of your boyfriend to keep you waiting.

Dialogue: He loses track of time easily.

Dialogue: Sir?

Dialogue: Demidov's right. He's here somewhere...

Dialogue: We have to do something--

Dialogue: We have to wait.

Dialogue: Yes but--

Dialogue: She's my agent. She's my responsibility.

Dialogue: Where's Taylor?

Dialogue: That's not Alexander Pearce.

Dialogue: He is NOT Alexander Pearce!

Dialogue: Good bye Mr. Pearce.

Dialogue: Ackerman!

Dialogue: Do it.

Dialogue: Are you all right?

Dialogue: I did well to choose you on the train...

Dialogue: You didn't get to arrest Alexander Pearce...

Dialogue: He never showed up.

Speaker: frank
Dialogue: You're wrong. I'm here.

Speaker: cara
Dialogue: Why?

Dialogue: Cara... I want the paramedics to make sure you're all right--

Dialogue: No we won't. There's nothing to talk about. I don't work for you anymore.

Dialogue: Mr.   Taylor...   you're free to go.

Dialogue: He was here.

Dialogue: A mistake perhaps?

Dialogue: Looks like 744 million.

Dialogue: That's no mistake...  That's his tax bill.

Dialogue: Oh but I did get my man, Ms. Jones.

Dialogue: There's something I don't understand... how did Pearce manage to get here and open that safe without anybody noticing? And where did he go?

Dialogue: Because Pearce was cleverer than all of us.

Dialogue: It's good to see you too.
